item.title: Ferrari Branches Out Into Sailing With Engine-Free Racing Yacht
item.description: Ferrari NV unveiled a prototype racing yacht that will hit the ocean next year as the supercar maker branches out into sailing.
item.dc:creator: Daniele Lepido

media:content.media:description: Ferrari’s prototype racing yacht.

item.title: Tencent Adding Supercell Titles to WeChat Mini Games
item.description: Tencent Holdings Ltd. is converting some of the world’s most popular mobile games into WeChat mini games.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Zheping Huang

media:content.media:description: Brawl Stars Source: Google Play

item.title: Jane Street Boss Says He Was Duped Into Funding AK-47s for Coup
item.description: The indictment reads like a cinematic plot: A Harvard Fellow and another activist allegedly wanted to buy AK-47s, Stinger missiles and grenades to topple South Sudan’s government. What they lacked was enough cash.
item.dc:creator: Ava Benny-Morrison, Sridhar Natarajan

media:content.media:description: Photographs of weaponry the defendants allegedly sought to buy and export to South Sudan to stage a coup.

item.title: Micron Faces Earnings Test After Share Price Doubled Since April
item.description: Investors looking for new ways to bet on artificial intelligence infrastructure have been piling into an old but often overlooked name: Micron Technology Inc.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke

item.title: Prosus CEO Bloisi Aims to Double Revenue in Next Three Years
item.description: Technology investor Prosus NV targets to double its revenue over the next three years as the company focuses on building out large e-commerce platforms, Chief Executive Officer Fabricio Bloisi said during its capital markets day on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

media:content.media:description: Fabricio Bloisi

item.title: CATL Prioritizing Overseas Expansion as EV Price War Persists
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., the world’s largest electric vehicle battery maker, is making overseas expansion its “No. 1 priority” as intense competition in China’s domestic car market threatens the industry’s health, according to Chief Manufacturing Officer Ni Jun.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Chunying Zhang, Linda Lew, Stephen Engle

media:content.media:description: CATL branding.

item.title: Juventus FC’s Crypto Investor Has Turned Activist and Wants a Board Seat
item.description: On Valentine’s Day, El Salvador-based crypto firm Tether announced it had become an investor in Juventus, one of Italy’s most distinguished football clubs. Four months later, the relationship is not going well.
item.dc:creator: Emily Nicolle, Giulia Morpurgo

media:content.media:description: Dusan Vlahovic of Juventus FC celebrates scoring a goal during the FIFA Club World Cup 2025 group G match at Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia, on June 22. Photographer: David Ramos/Getty Images

item.title: Polish Fintech Bets on Erste Entry to Speed Up Foreign Expansion
item.description: Poland’s most successful mobile-payment company is hoping that new shareholder Erste Group Bank AG will accelerate its expansion in eastern Europe.
item.dc:creator: Konrad Krasuski

item.title: China Vows ‘Forceful Measures’ After Taiwan’s Huawei Export Curb
item.description: Beijing vowed to respond to Taiwan’s “technological blockades” after the self-ruled island blacklisted Chinese companies including Huawei Technologies Co., limiting their ability to develop cutting-edge artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Jing Li

media:content.media:description: Photo by PATRICIA DE MELO MOREIRA/AFP /AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: PATRICIA DE MELO MOREIRA/AFP

item.title: New Zealand’s Xero to Buy Melio Payments in $2.5 Billion Deal
item.description: Xero Ltd., a cloud-based accounting software firm, agreed to buy Melio Payments Inc. for $2.5 billion as the New Zealand company pushes deeper into the US market with its biggest-ever acquisition.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Adam Haigh

media:content.media:description: A woman working from home with a laptop computer and mobile phone in the U.K. Photographer: Bloomberg Creative Photos/Bloomberg Creative Collection

item.title: Columbia Investigating Possible Cyberattack After Website Outage
item.description: Columbia University is investigating whether a widespread system outage Tuesday was the result of a cyberattack on the Ivy League school, according to people familiar with the situation.
item.dc:creator: Nacha Cattan, Cameron Fozi

media:content.media:description: Photo by CHARLY TRIBALLEAU/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: CHARLY TRIBALLEAU/AFP

item.title: ‘South Park’ Creators Say Skydance Is Blocking $2.5 Billion Deal
item.description: Comedy Central’s prospective owner has its own views on a possible streaming agreement
item.dc:creator: Lucas Shaw

media:content.media:description: Matt Stone, left, and Trey Parker attend South Park The 25th Anniversary Concert at Red Rocks Amphitheatre in Morrison, Colorado, in 2022.

item.title: How Telegram Became a Magnet for Extremists, Crime
item.description: Messaging service Telegram is one of the most downloaded apps worldwide. Its private chat setting has made it a free space for open discussion in countries with authoritarian regimes. But a relatively light-touch approach to content moderation on Telegram is frustrating governments trying to stop criminal activities and the spread of misinformation that can destabilize societies.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Thornber, Jeff Stone

media:content.media:description: Pavel Durov Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: Chip Designer Ambarella Explores Potential Sale
item.description: Chip design company Ambarella Inc. is considering options including a potential sale, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Dinesh Nair

media:content.media:description: Ambarella Inc. headquarters in Santa Clara, California.

item.title: Polymarket Is Set to Raise Funding at $1 Billion Valuation
item.description: Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund is leading the investment.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark

media:content.media:description: A Polymarket advertisement in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Monday, July 22, 2024. Various US election outcomes have propelled open wagers close to $1 billion on Polymarket, a 500% jump over the past few months, even though Polymarket says it has excluded US users since 2022 as part of a settlement with federal regulators.

item.title: Circle’s 750% Surge Heats Up Debate Over Stablecoin Payments
item.description: A surge in shares of Circle Internet Group Inc., lifted by a wave of optimism about US stablecoins, has investors and market-watchers alike wondering just how much upside could be left in the near-term for the newly publicly-traded company.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Reinicke, Monique Mulima

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) during the Circle Internet Financial Ltd. initial public offering (IPO) in New York, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. Circle shares surged as much as 235% after the company and some of its shareholders raised nearly $1.1 billion in an initial public offering that was upsized twice amid strong demand.

item.title: One of the Best Hackers in the Country is an AI Bot
item.description: Xbow, the startup behind a highly ranked hacking security tool, has raised $75 million
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Xbow founder Oege de Moor

item.title: Trump’s Chip Tariff Threat Sparks Pushback From Auto Industry to Tech
item.description: Blowback to President Donald Trump’s idea of tariffs on imported semiconductors is proving to be broad and deep, stretching from auto companies and boat makers to the technology industry and crypto enthusiasts, according to a review of more than 150 public comments on the proposal.
item.dc:creator: Michael Shepard

media:content.media:description: A stacker sorts silicon wafers. Photographer: Kyle Green/Bloomberg

item.title: Job Hunting Firm CareerBuilder + Monster Files Bankruptcy
item.description: CareerBuilder + Monster, a firm that brought together early trailblazers in online job recruiting, filed for bankruptcy protection in Delaware as business continues to shrivel.
item.dc:creator: Reshmi Basu, Luca Casiraghi, Georgia Hall

media:content.media:description: Job seekers wait in line to speak with representatives during the TechFair LA career fair in Los Angeles, California, U.S., on Thursday, March 8, 2018. The U.S. Department of Labor is scheduled to release initial jobless claims on March 15. Photographer: Patrick T. Fallon/Bloomberg

item.title: Microsoft Plans Major Job Cuts at Xbox Gaming Division
item.description: The video-game division’s latest round of layoffs is expected next week
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: Xbox video game consoles and accessories at a Target store ahead of Black Friday in Clifton, New Jersey, US, on Tuesday, Nov. 26, 2024. Economists will be paying close attention to Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales to get a sense of consumers appetite for holiday shopping.

item.title: Alphabet Lacks Tesla’s Stock Buzz in Race for Driverless Rides
item.description: There’s a lot of investor excitement about driverless cars, yet Alphabet Inc.’s shares reflect little of that euphoria — even as its Waymo robotaxis proliferate in major US cities.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: A Waymo autonomous taxi, left, and a vehicle Tesla is using for robotaxi testing purposes in Austin, Texas, US, on Friday, June 20, 2025. Elon Musk said Tesla Inc. has set June 22 as a tentative launch date for the start of its robotaxi network.

item.title: Labubu Mania Breathes New Life Into Chinese Consumers
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Luz Ding reports on the experience of China’s big summer shopping festival, which was dominated by a homegrown global sensation.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: Labubu dolls on display at a Pop Mart International Group Ltd. store in Shanghai, China, on Tuesday, June 17, 2025. Celebrities including Rihanna and BlackPink’s Lisa have been spotted carrying Pop Mart’s toys, making it one of China’s most notable consumer brands to gain popularity globally.

item.title: Uber and Waymo Begin Driverless Ride-Hailing Service in Atlanta
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. on Tuesday will begin offering its customers driverless Waymo rides in Atlanta, making it the second market, after Austin, where the two companies are teaming up instead of competing against each other.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: A Waymo robotaxi in San Francisco.

item.title: ChatGPT Wows Office Workers. That's a Problem for Microsoft
item.description: Microsoft is struggling to sell its Copilot AI assistant to corporations because many of their employees want ChatGPT.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford, Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: The ChatGPT logo on a laptop computer arranged in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Thursday, March 9, 2023. ChatGPT has made writing computer code and cheating on homework easier. Soon, it could make email scams a cinch. That's the warning from Darktrace Plc, the British cybersecurity firm.

item.title: China on Cusp of Seeing Over 100 DeepSeeks, Ex-Top Official Says
item.description: China’s advantages in developing artificial intelligence are about to unleash a wave of innovation that will generate more than 100 DeepSeek-like breakthroughs in the coming 18 months, according to a former top official.
item.dc:creator: Lucille Liu

item.title: Saudi Tech Firm Ejada to Reapply for IPO After Approval Expires
item.description: Saudi Arabian technology services company Ejada Systems Ltd. is planning to reapply with kingdom’s regulator for its initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Laura Gardner Cuesta, Christine Burke

media:content.media:description: The Saudi Stock Exchange in Riyadh. Photographer: Mohammed Almuaalemi/Bloomberg

item.title: Google Faces UK Pressure Over AI Search Summary, Advertising
item.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google is set to face more scrutiny from the UK’s antitrust watchdog over its online search and advertising business.
item.dc:creator: Upmanyu Trivedi

media:content.media:description: The Google headquarters in Mountain View, California, US. Photographer David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: VC Firm Project A Raises €325 Million Fund for European Startups
item.description: Project A, a German venture capital firm that has placed early bets on defense startups, raised a €325 million ($373 million) fund to back European companies.
item.dc:creator: Christina Kyriasoglou

media:content.media:description: Partner and managing director for UK, Project A Malin Posern

item.title: JPMorgan Sees Asian Tech Stocks Gaining Another 15-20% This Year
item.description: Asian technology stocks may rally another 15%-20% this year, driven mainly by the strong momentum in the artificial intelligence space, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.
item.dc:creator: Jeanny Yu

item.title: YouTube Exemption From Australian Teen Social Media Ban Opposed by Regulator
item.description: Australia’s online regulator called on the government to reverse its controversial exemption for YouTube from a social media ban for under-16s, an unusual intervention that echoes similar pleas from rival platforms including Facebook and TikTok.
item.dc:creator: Angus Whitley

media:content.media:description: Photo by JOSH EDELSON/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: JOSH EDELSON/AFP
